bibl.title: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to Lunsford D. Fricks, May 6, 1923

div1.p: [Carter] inquires about the Committee on Resolutions, subcommittee for the National Malaria Committee.

div1.head: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to Lunsford D. Fricks, May 6, 1923
div1.opener:
N. M. C
Sub. committe
/LC
, D. C.,
May 6, 1923.
Surgeon Lunsford D. Fricks,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Secretary National Malaria Committee,
Room 17, Court House Building,
Memphis, Tenn.
Dear Doctor Fricks:
div1.p:
In the list of the Sub-Committees of the N. M. C. you sent me
no Committee on Resolutions was given. This was provided for in a
resolution at the Memphis meeting of 1917. Has it been abrogated?
It was intended to prevent insufficiently considered action. As
you know, similar arrangements exist in the A. M. A.: A. P. H. A. and,
I think, in nearly all bodies of any size which have short times of
meeting.
